person_022.name: Henri-LouisDuhamel du Monceau
person_022.description: French physician, naval engineer and botanist. ForMemRSL.

person_945.name: Charles-François Brisseaude Mirbel
person_945.description: a French botanist and politician. He was a founder of the science of plant cytology.

person_947.name: JamesBrindley
person_947.description: English canal engineer who invented the technique of puddling clay and using it to line canals.

person_946.name: HeinrichSchrader
person_946.description: It is possible Davy means Heinrich Schrader, a German botanist and mycologist.

person_581.name: Henry CharlesEnglefield
person_581.description: Seventh baronet from 1780 and a prominent Roman Catholic antiquarian and geologist. FRSL.

person_020.name: NehemiahGrew
person_020.description: English plant anatomist and physiologist, known as the 'Father of Plant Anatomy'. FRSL.

person_036.name: IsaacNewton
person_036.description: Prominent English natural philosopher and mathematician greatly admired by Davy who once under the influence of several litres of nitrous oxide wrote in his notebook 'Davy & Newton' in one inch letters. FRSL.

person_021.name: StephenHales
person_021.description: English clergyman who made major contributions to a range of scientific fields including botany, pneumatic chemistry and physiology.  FRSL.

person_024.name: Thomas AndrewKnight
person_024.description: Knight was a botanist and horticulturalist. He was the second president of the Royal Horticulture Society. Davy frequently fished on Knight's esates in the Welsh Marches. FRSL.

person_016.name: JosephPriestley
person_016.description: Unitarian and political radical forced into exile in Pennsylvania. As a natural philospher and chemist who retained belief in phlogiston, he discovered oxygen and nitrous oxide though not under those names. FRSL.

person_521.name: Joseph-MichelMontgolfier
person_521.description: French co-inventor with his brother of the hot-air balloon; also invented the hydraulic ram (1796).

place_121.name: England
place_121.description: England is a country that is part of the United Kingdom. It is located on the island of Great Britain, of which it covers approximately 62%, and over 100 smaller adjacent islands.
